reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This B&B is in a great location on a small beach looking out to the Skellig islands. My room had a great view of the beach - which is about 20m from the front door. The host is really friendly and made us a very nice breakfast.
reviews.title: Great location, lovely host

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything about this B&B was excellent. We only stayed for two days but enjoyed every moment. The room we had looked out over St. Finan's Bay and the beautiful views this provided. The vista's are constantly changing. The chocolate factory just up the road was something I was prepared for, but maybe not quite how lovely it would be. Bridie was a joy to talk to. A wealth of local information and a very pleasant woman. Thank you.
reviews.title: What a beautiful location

reviews.text: Outstanding. Great location for getting away. Very friendly and helpful. Would highly recommend.
reviews.title: Outstanding

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved loved loved this B&B! It is tucked away, and finding it can be tricky, but it is well worth it. Coming from Portmagee, you have to go over mountain and then all the way down again to find the Beach Cove. If you are going to Ireland...go to the Skelligs. If you are going to the Skelligs...Stay at Beach Cove. Bridie does a wonderful job, and the location is amazing. You can see the Skelligs from the beach in her front yard. The house itself is immaculate, and we had a huge room that looked at on the beach. I only wished we would have stayed longer.
reviews.title: You will love the view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose Beach Cove based on the promise of a beach close by, and we were not disappointed. The beach is right across the road and wonderfully uncrowded-a wonderful change after the Ring of Kerry. The hosts were lovely, Bridie arranged our trip out to Skellig Michael for us and even loaned us her binoculars. We fell asleep listening to the ocean waves out of our window.
reviews.title: Absolutely wonderful and idyllic

reviews.text: I do very much agree as I think all reviewers of the Beach Cove B&B would that this place feels like it's in the middle of nowhere....that's what we loved about it. After spending some time in larger cities, it was nice to change it up a bit. Bridie is the most amazing host and I've stayed in a ton of B&Bs. You can definitely hear the waves crashing and watch catch of a glimpse of the Skelligs from the big bay window where you'll take in breakfast. Accomodations were comfortable and Bridie even offered to let us use her phone to call my father in the US! I do agree, the road is treacherous, but after driving 1200kms, you come to understand that most Irish roads aren't much better and could be worse. There is also a fabulous church/cemetery to explore almost next door. We would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Get away from it all!

reviews.text: The location of the Beach Cove B&B really is in what can be called a remote area of Southwestern Ireland. However when driving there (it is located about 20 minutes from the Ring of Kerry drive) we never felt unsafe or in the middle of nowhere. There were signs of human life everywhere:-) (compared to some parts of Southwestern USA). By the way, there are serveral roads leading to the B&B - some might not be on the map you are using. There is a direct way to Valencia Island and a cost line to Ballinskelligs.
reviews.title: Unwind - relax - enjoy

reviews.text: Whe getting to the B&B we were astonished by the great view across the ocean. We got one of the top ensuite rooms with a big window facing the ocean. There was even a little sitting place right by the window where we sat and what the ocean for hours. Leaving the Ring of Kerry sure was worth it because we didn't find this ring itself quite as great as other rings and coast roads we had taken before. This additional ring (sorry forgot the name) passing the B&B is in our opinion much nicer and more interesting. Valencia Island was great, too. We sat in the sun on a bench by the port and watched the car ferry for a while. There really is a mediteraneen feeling to the island and Kingstown in particular.
reviews.title: Bridie -- The Personification of the Accomodating Hostess

reviews.text: The B&B was nicely furnished and perfectly clean. Make sure to book ahead of time. Bridie told us that July and August are almost full (but only almost) because there are many guests who return each year and book a year ahead. The price of €60 for two people was absolutely reasonable for the nice room - the view really was amazing - and the very good breakfast. Bridie was a really nice and welcoming innkeeper. We highly recommand this B&B.
reviews.title: nice nice nice

reviews.text: My daughter and I had the pleasure of staying with Bridie and her family in March. Our story is unusual because, on the way to her house, we lost the clutch in our rental car. We literally coasted into her driveway and, while it's true she's out in the middle of nowhere, let me assure you, I was never happier than when I saw her driveway come into view.
reviews.title: Awesome!!!
Wonderful location, comfortable, friendly service
reviews.text: We only stayed one night, but we loved this B&B. Our huge room was upstairs with two comfortable beds, large bathroom, and window seat where we could sit and look out to the bay. Bridie is so friendly and eager to please. Like the reviewer before us, we were not able to get out to Skellig Michael because of stormy weather, but Bridie's hospitality and this B&B's lovely location made up for it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the tea and muffins Bridie served when we arrived, to the warmth and comfort of their home, to the breathtaking views and sounds of the crashing waves from our room, everything about the Beach Cove B&B was absolutely perfect. Bridie and Jack are generous, kind hosts in the paradise that is Ballinskelligs. We stayed several nights and, even though high seas prevented our hoped-for trip to the Skelligs, we had an extraordinary time exploring Ballinskelligs, Portmagee, and the pre-historic sites of the Ring of Kerry, the Dingle Peninsula, and Valentia Island from our base at the Beach Cove (and having Skelligs Chocolate Company practically next door didn't hurt, either). We cannot recommend the Beach Cove B&B highly enough.
reviews.title: Beach Cove B&B is absolute perfection.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only stayed for one night but a real gem. Stunning location right on St. Finan's Bay along the Ring of Skellig. We had no problems finding the place and found the road absolutely fine (despite what other reviewers said), in fact we really enjoyed the views on the way. Our room was lovely (i particularly enjoyed the window seat and the fact you could see the sea even sitting in bed) and very comfortable. Bridie was very friendly and helpful both when booking and when I phoned to say we would be a bit later arriving. It was the cheapest place we stayed on our trip and but equally good if not better than quite a few of the other places we stayed including hotels!
reviews.title: Stunning location - real find

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here 2 nights as we made our way around the Ring of Kerry. Bridie was very accommodating and personable. The rooms were nicely decorated and very cozy with a view of the beach! You can hear the ocean as you sleep! The breakfast was very good and the view from the breakfast room with "Johnny Cash" music in the background gave us a great sensation of peace and tranquility during breakfast. Be sure and go for a walk around the place.....it was one of my best memories....the scenery is so beautiful and relaxing! Bridie helped us make a reservation on the boat to visit the Skellig Rocks....it is a MUST SEE....the scenery was incredible and we even saw some seals! The 2 night stay enabled us to really enjoy the coast and countryside of that area which is spectacular and to see the Skellig Rocks and Valencia Island as we worked our way around the Ring. You might have to ask a few people along the way for directions on how to get to this bed and breakfast but it is well worth the effort.....this place is truly a hidden gem in a precious corner of Ireland. We loved it!!
reviews.title: Like a dream!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This delightful B&B is beautifully located right next to St. Finian's Bay in Ballinskellig. It is one of the most stunning beach coves in Ireland and well worth a visit.
reviews.title: A pure delight

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Beach Cove for a couple of night as we made our way round the Ring of Kerry, hoping to make the crossing over to the Skellig Rock to see the puffins.
reviews.title: A perfect location & lovely accomodation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose this B&B due to the picture that advertises it - right next to a beach. When we arrived, we saw that it did indeed sit right next to a small cove overlooking the Skelligs, which we loved.
reviews.title: Wonderful!

reviews.text: Bridie who runs the B&B was extremely friendly and kindly enquired about the boat trip for us. She showed us up to our room, which overlooked the beach and you could hear the waves crashing through the window, which is enough to guarrantee a restful sleep.
reviews.title: Loved the Beachcove B&B

likes.disliked: — To get dinner, you had to drive over treacherous mountain roads.

reviews.title: A Must stay if you're doing Skellig Michael
reviews.text: The room was very clean and nicely decorated & very comfortable. A nice touch was the leaflets about the local area that were provided in the room. Bridie herself is extremely helpful and recommended a couple of good places to eat in Portmagee (The Bridge Bar) and also was able to guide our remaining few days around the Ring of Kerry.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was great and overlooked the beach. I was also pleased to see that as a vegetarian, I also had a hearty cooked breakfast & a selection of cereals were also available.
reviews.title: Peace and Quiet
